page.title: 02LANDSCAPE TREDINNICK FARM
page.content: Tredinnick farm is owned by Mr Joe Rowe and family.It is a 16th century house(1500-1600)with 320 acres of land.He grows fodder beat,barley and turnips.He grows fodder beat for cows and barley for any of his animals.He has no sheep,110 cows,98 milking cows and 150 bullocks.The cows produce 560,000 litres a year(1,000,000 pints).The cows he has got are Fresian,Hereford,Angus,Charolais and Limousin.He employs two workers on the farm and he has three barns.He has a hay barn,a straw barn and a corn barn.He grows grass for the dairy cows.He has got 4 tractors which are Case,Ford,Massey and Universal.The machinery he has got is fodder beat harvester,corn crusher,3 corn angurs, transport box,mower,hay turner,plough, roller,slurry buggy,dung spreader, cultivators,topper and yard scrape.
